title: THEO OF GOLDEN
author: Allen Levi
description: A man travels to a small Southern town, where he purchases pencil drawings of local residents and exchanges them for stories.

title: PROJECT HAIL MARY
author: Andy Weir
description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.

title: THE HARD LINE
author: Mark Greaney
description: The 15th book in the Gray Man series. As he tries to stop hit squads, Court Gentry becomes the target of an assassin known as Whetstone.

title: THE CORRESPONDENT
author: Virginia Evans
description: Letters from someone she used to know push Sybil Van Antwerp toward revisiting her past and finding a way to forgive.

title: DEAR DEBBIE
author: Freida McFadden
description: An advice columnist who is having trouble at work and home decides to get back at people she thinks deserve it.

title: STRIPPED DOWN
author: Bunnie Xo
description: The host of the “Dumb Blonde Podcast” shares how redemption was an important part of her journey toward reaching her goals.

title: NOBODY'S GIRL
author: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
description: The late activist and advocate for sex-trafficking survivors describes her time with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: AMERICAN STRUGGLE
author: Jon Meacham
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer examines national divisions and debates over the last four centuries.

title: MANUFACTURING DELUSION
author: Buck Sexton
description: A conservative radio host and former C.I.A. analyst argues that mass delusion has begun to take hold in America.

title: THE LOOK
author: Michelle Obama with Meredith Koop
description: A celebration of the former first lady’s evolution in style, featuring more than 200 photographs.

title: STOP, IN THE NAME OF GOD
author: Charlie Kirk

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: GROWING HOME
author: Beth Ferry. Illustrated Terry Fan and Eric Fan
description: Talking plants, a grumpy goldfish and an inquisitive spider save the Tupper family from utter ruin. (Ages 6 to 9)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: UNSETTLING SALAD!
author: Aaron Reynolds. Illustrated Peter Brown
description: Thadeus and Oliver take a bite out of a salad that may bite back! (Ages 6 to 9)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LEPRECHAUN
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: This is the year you'll finally catch a leprechaun. (Ages 4 to 10)

title: MOTHER BRUCE
author: Ryan T. Higgins
description: Bruce the Bear acquires a flock of goslings. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: FOR THE FANS!
author: Angela Song
description: Meet the members of the K-pop group Huntrix. (Ages 2 to 5)

title: HOW TO CATCH THE EASTER BUNNY
author: Adam Wallace and Andy Elkerton
description: The Easter Bunny avoids traps in order to deliver eggs and candy. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: DRAGONS LOVE TACOS
author: Adam Rubin.. Illustrated Daniel Salmieri
description: What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: BOYS OF TOMMEN
author: Chloe Walsh
description: In Ireland, friends at the private school Tommen College prepare for adulthood. (Ages 16 to 18)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: THE SUN AND THE STARMAKER
author: Rachel Griffin
description: The Starmaker senses a powerful magic within Aurora Finch and requests that she come study under his tutelage. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: FAKE SKATING
author: Lynn Painter
description: After years of separation, the childhood friends Alec and Dani reunite and face their true feelings toward each other. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A STAGE SET FOR VILLAINS
author: Shannon J. Spann
description: Riven Hesper makes a deal with a “Player,” an immortal being, to save her own life. (Ages 16 and up)

title: IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
author: Laura Nowlin
description: In this companion to “If He Had Been With Me,” the story of Finn and Autumn is told through three different perspectives. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)
